title: Ticket #7245: Scary (but misleading) message from condor_submit
description:
When working with a user, we decided to submit an interactive job (with a few GB of input) to see if their code was working.

This is what they got: 

$ condor_submit -i interactive.sub
Submitting job(s).
1 job(s) submitted to cluster 12345.
Waiting for job to start...
slot1_2@build.example.com: Rejecting request, because the job execution environment is not yet ready.
slot1_2@build.example.com: Rejecting request, because the job execution environment is not yet ready.
slot1_2@build.example.com: Rejecting request, because the job execution environment is not yet ready.
slot1_2@build.example.com: Rejecting request, because the job execution environment is not yet ready.
....

For about 5 minutes (the amount of time it took to stage in the input sandbox).

  1. This statement is completely true as written. The job execution environment is, indeed, not yet ready.
  2. This is still scary and misleading.

Can we provide something about the state ("... because the job inputs are still being downloaded"); failing that, can we say "please wait" instead of "Rejecting request"?
remarks:
2019-Sep-06 08:28:09 by gthain:
I'll start with just a simple rewording to avoid use confusion.

Ideally, we'd know roughly what percentage of file transfer is done and print that.

2019-Sep-06 13:26:57 by tlmiller:
See also #7190.

2019-Oct-03 16:53:17 by gthain:
This doesn't warrant a version history entry.
check_ins: 2019-Sep-06 08:27   Check-in [57787]: When retyring a ssh-to-job, print "Retrying", not "Rejecting" #7245 (By Greg Thain )
creator: bbockelm
